intro: Alsine seguieri, commonly known as the common alsike, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grasslands. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, while its stems are upright and branched. Alsine seguieri is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinators.
